losses module¶

class losses.Loss(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: function.Function

backward()¶

Backward pass for the loss function. Since it should be the final layer of an architecture, no input is needed for the backward pass.

Returns:

gradX: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). Local gradient of the loss.

forward(X, Y)¶

Computes the loss of x with respect to y.

Args:

X: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). Y: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim).

Returns:

loss: numpy.float.

local_grad(X, Y)¶

Local gradient with respect to X at (X, Y).

Args:

X: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). Y: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim).

Returns:

gradX: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim).

class losses.MeanSquareLoss(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: losses.Loss

forward(X, Y)¶

Computes the mean square error of X with respect to Y.

Args:

X: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). Y: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim).

Returns:

mse_loss: numpy.float. Mean square error of x with respect to y.

local_grad(X, Y)¶

Local gradient with respect to X at (X, Y).

Args:

X: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). Y: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim).

Returns:

gradX: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). Gradient of MSE wrt X at X and Y.

class losses.Multinomial_Logistic_Regression(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: losses.Loss

forward(probs, y_labels)¶

Computes the cross entropy loss of x with respect to y.

Args:

X: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). y: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, 1). Should contain class labels

for each data point in x.

Returns:

crossentropy_loss: numpy.float. Cross entropy loss of x with respect to y.

local_grad(probs, y_labels)¶

Local gradient with respect to X at (X, Y).

Args:

X: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim). Y: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim).

Returns:

gradX: numpy.ndarray of shape (n_batch, n_dim).
